customerReviewBodies:
I love clothing cut to look kind of gender neutral, so these shirts are perfect for me. They have a somewhat androgynous fit, with a more or less straight cut from armpit to hip. I have a few slim fit men‚Äôs shirts because that‚Äôs my look, but these are far better, since they are made to fit a figure with hips (which means it fits all the way down without buttons straining to the bottom of the shirt). Bonus: great price.

So if you are looking for a straight fit (as opposed to tailored or princess seamed, which is made to create an hourglass), this is a great shirt with lots of fabric options. See pics for a few I got!

I wear a lot of button-downs, mostly as over-shirts with cami's and tanks.
This one meets my expectations.

The fabric is a little thin, but not see-through by any means. I would consider it summer-weight.
Wrinkles sort of easily while worn, so this might be more suited for casual wear. Comes out of the dryer not needing to be ironed, if you remove it promptly. I launder on warm and dry on lukewarm and have noticed no shrinkage.
Stitching is top-notch - no flubbed seams or errant threads.

I am 5'7" and 175, very full B cup, waist is 37" and hips are 45" - I typically wear a L-XL top, in major US brands. I ordered this in the XL and the fit is pretty good. I have "beefy" arms, and this shirt is NOT too tight in the arm for me - I have plenty of arm room.

Manufactured in Bangladesh.

Gratefully received through the üåøVine Programüåø for my *honest and unbiased* review.

customerReviewTitles: Amazon Essentials V Neck 3/4 Sleeve Top Classic Fit
Exactly what I was looking for!
customerReviewBodies:
This long-sleeve V neck top is made from 56 percent cotton, 37 percent modal, 7 percent elastane. The fabric is medium tee-shirt weight, is super soft and stretchy. The material moves with the user so the top is very comfortable to wear. Classic fit means it has a looser fit through the torso.

The large size top is 27 inches in length and the chest circumference measured from the underarm seam all the way around is 41 to 42 inches. The bottom edge circumference is 44 inches and the hem on the bottom edge and sleeve opening is 1/2 inch as is the neckline band. Measured from the top of the shoulder the 3/4 length sleeves are 18 inches in long.

Machine wash warm with like colors, non-chlorine bleach when needed, tumble dry low heat and cool iron if needed. Do not dry clean. This is a classic style that works well with casual or work clothing one of those wardrobe basics both comfortable and versatile. Excellent.
T
I am 5 ft. 5 inches tall and 127 lbs. I am wearing a size small. It is a bit roomy, and I think I could easily wear a size extra small in this as well if I wanted it to be more fitted.

I originally purchased two of these tops (one black and the other white) thinking I would just wear them around the house. But, they are nice and comfortable, enough to wear out and about casually. I washed them and put them in the dryer and they didn‚Äôt shrink. A cool iron if you‚Äôre going to wear them out, but really, the wrinkles are very minimal. They are soft and not too heavy...perfect for cool weather. I am a 36 D, so I ordered a large which is a perfect fit...not too tight.

The length is good as well. I'm 6'1" and it fits nicely. Material is really nice (again exactly what I was looking for) smooth, soft and stretchy. I will be buying more in other colors. It is slightly tighter in the sleeves (not in a way that restricts movement, just no loose fabric) and looser in the torso (not in a "boxy" way, just a feminine cut with a little extra room to not highlight any rolls). Like some of the other reviews mention, it has a slightly longer torso as well (great for the taller ladies, maybe not so much if you are shorter). The fabric is soft and stretchy, and light enough without being see-through. Overall for the price, this is the shirt you need if you are looking for a logo-less 3/4 sleeve.

I'm 5'5 about 118 lbs with a long torso and I generally wear a size small in tops. I ordered this in xsmall after looking at the photos and other reviews. 3.5 stars would be a more accurate rating but that wasn't an option so I bumped it up instead of down due to the nice fabric.

The bad: It does my figure NO favors. I don't like tight t shirts but ones that just have a little bit of shape that hint at there being a female form underneath and not a cardboard box. Unfortunately this tshirt gives me a "shoebox" body shape. I've attached a photo of how it hangs naturally vs when I pull it back at the waist so show how my body is actually shaped. If it was just tapered in around the waist even a tad more I'd be much happier with the silhouette.

The good : It's SUPER SOFT. Extremely comfortable. The sleeves are the perfect length in my opinion. The neckline is also perfect for a casual tshirt. Not constricting at all but not flashy either. Great length. I'm wearing a nude bra underneath in my photos and I could not see it at all through the shirt. It has a nice thickness, but as you can see at the bottom you can see my shorts through it so don't expect to be able to wear a black bra without noticing it.

All in all I think I will keep these as "around the house" shirts since they are affordable and so comfortable. If you want a nice weight, soft, non-sheer tee and don't care about it having any shape whatsoever, then it's a great option.

Last year, I bought a number of Under Armour clothing and since then, Under Armour has become my favorite workout clothing brand! I love the quality of the clothes, color selection, and how they are designed to keep you cool (or warm, depending on the line). I decided to get some more workout shirts this year and wanted to try some with a pattern rather than just the solid shirts, since I have some of those already. I didn't have any of the Twist Tech shirts and decided to give them a try.

This Under Armour Twist Tech shirt is part of Under Armour's HeatGear line, which is designed to keep you cool in warm weather. This shirt is considered a LOOSE fit, which means you will most likely want to purchase a smaller size for a more comfortable fit. The shirt has a flattering V-neck cut and has a twisted, or heathered, pattern that makes it different than a solid color shirt. These shirts are made in Jordan of 100% polyester. Washing instructions say to wash with similar colors. I always put these in the washing machine on a normal cycle, hang them up to dry, and I've never had a problem with shrinking.

I initially purchased one of these shirts to make sure I had the right size and loved it so much I ordered two more! For size reference, I am 5'6", 165 pounds, with a 36D chest and some extra belly fat from my twin pregnancy and I purchased a medium. I typically wear a medium or large in shirts and, since this shirt is a loose fit, I went with the medium and it fits perfectly! These shirts are so comfortable and I wear them a lot for working out. They keep me as cool and dry as possible (of course, I still sweat). They wash up well and I am also able to wear them for everyday wear with yoga pants. My mom is in her early 60s and wears these shirts for everyday wear, along with under her scrubs for work. She loves them as much as I do and wants to get some more! customerReviewTitles: Not an authentic Under Armour shirt
Great Shirt but This One Runs Big!
One of my favorite workout tops!
customerReviewBodies: I

I'm an active person and I love to walk and exercise whenever I can. I typically opt for the racerback tank top style for my workout shirts but I'm also very fair-skinned and I wanted a bit more protection from the sun for my shoulders and back when I'm outside during peak sunshine hours. I own a number of Under Armour products so I was well aware of the quality when I decided to purchase this shirt. Like a lot of people, I was hesitant on the sizing since Under Armour's clothes fit differently depending on the style. Under Armour classifies this shirt as a loose fit as opposed to semi-fitted, fitted, or compression fit.

For reference, I am 5'6", 150 pounds, with a 36D chest and a medium fits me perfectly! I wear a medium or large depending on the style and fit of the shirt but, thanks to the help of other reviewers, I was able to successfully order my correct size for this shirt. This shirt is part of UA's Heatgear line which is meant to keep you cool when it's warm out. I've already worn this shirt several times and it is incredibly comfortable. It is made in Jordan of 100% polyester and is very soft and lightweight. It is so comfortable that I don't have any problems with range of motion or anything while exercising. This shirt is a V-neck style which is nice since it adds a little bit of a design over the scoop neck style shirts and it still has good chest coverage so I don't feel like I'm indecent while bending over. It has an UA logo on the left side of the chest as well as one on the back of the shirt, just below the neck. The length is also really nice and comfortably rests on my upper thighs. I've worn this shirt while walking and playing basketball and have still managed to stay fairly cool. Even though this shirt is lightweight, I don't feel that it's sheer and would show anything that's not meant to be seen. The shirt also washes up nicely. I typically hang dry these shirts so they don't get caught on anything in the dryer and so far, they've been great!

I'm so happy I found this shirt because it's become my go-to t-shirt for working out when I don't want to wear my racerbacks. I originally ordered the Montana Teal/Metallic Silver color and loved it so much that I also ordered Flint/Metallic Silver and Coho/Metallic Silver. I've included a picture of my three shirts so you can see what they look like. At first I thought the Flint/Metallic Silver was a gray color but when I got it, it's actually more of a dusky lilac and, since I love purple, I am even happier! I think the hardest thing for most people is to figure out what size to order for this shirt. My thoughts are, if you have two sizes of shirts that you normally order depending on the brand and style, order the smaller size for this shirt. That's what I did and these shirts ended up fitting me perfectly. They are even nice enough to wear out in public so they are definitely versatile. I highly recommend these shirts because they are great for exercising, there are a lot of colors to choose from, and the price is perfect so you can order more than one!

I really love this top - it's one of my favorite workout tops! It's lightweight and wicks moisture really well. It's flattering, with the v-neck and the flattering, feminine cut, and it's VERY comfortable to wear. I'm a 40C, usually wear a L/12 or XL/14 top and I purchased this in the XL. It's loose enough around my curves that it's comfortable and doesn't make me self-conscious. The only thing I'd change is for it to be just an inch or two longer. I'm 5' 5" and this hits right at the top of my thigh/mid-butt, but because I've got a curvy backside it does tend to ride up a little when I'm working out (especially when walking/running). I really wish it was available in more colors - I would buy them all!

Perfect fit! I think I'm somewhat muscular and love this shirt. Quality is amazing for working out. You can seey sports bra and tattoos but can really seey actual skin so not too transparent. But overall, love it. I'm 180, pretty flat belly and I'm 5'1". My arms are bigger than a normal female and the sleeve are a bit tight but that's just cuz I have bigger than norm arms.

Under Armour makes some of the best t-shirts around and for a really great price. I own several different styles and sizes and often wear these to the gym or for a walk around my neighborhood. They are stylish yet modest. I wear mediums and larges in most UA shirts but ordered two of these (black and gray) in XL because the description states they are fitted and sometimes "fitted" on me is a bit tight. They fit well....with just the right amount of room...and feel so comfy. I will probably order more of these in different colors. For reference I am currently 5'4" and 150 lbs.

customerReviewBodies:
A super comfortable tee that can be worn to work! How great is that? The front twist that goes into a wide rear hem on this top gives it enough of an upgrade that there is no reason why this can't be worn into the office. It says it's a crop top, but with my short torso this fits closer to a regular tee. Having a larger chest will impact this, however. I did notice the difference in where the hem reached on me when trying on sans bra versus wearing one. I think if I had sized up, this problem wouldn't be present. Even going up a size or two to get the extra length in the front, this shirt won't be sloppy or baggy thanks to the way it's designed. The twist in the front helps with a nice little optical illusion of a smaller waist and fitted top even when it's a size bigger than you normally wear.

The fabric is silky soft and breathable, and isn't see through. Arm holes are aren't tight or restricting, and aren't so oversized that someone can see your side chest any time you raise your arm. Pretty easy to dress up or down with accessories, too. Being made from viscose means it won't shrink and doesn't wrinkle easily. Care is basic - machine wash on delicate cold and dry on low heat. Easy to care for, comfortable, flattering fit, decent price - what more can you ask for?

This is an incredibly comfortable shirt. It is made from a soft, smooth, stretchy jersey fabric. It does not look like active wear, though it could be used as such; this is actually a pretty versatile wardrobe piece, especially in the black color I ordered. The material is thin enough to comfortably layer over another shirt, or I can layer a sweater over it. Depending on what I pair it with, it can look dressy or casual. I am apple-shaped with a short torso, and on my body, this top hits at the perfect length to create a flattering illusion of a smaller waist. For size reference, I am 5 foot 7, weigh 165 pounds, have a 36C bust with narrow shoulders and (as mentioned) a short torso, carry most of my weight in the middle, and wear a US women's size 10 (medium sizes at Old Navy and H&M). I ordered this shirt in the "large", and love the fit, though to prevent my jiggly belly showing when I raise my arms, I either wear it with higher waisted skirts/ pants or over a tunic length cami. I included pictures with regular mid-rise pants to give a better idea of the shirt's length.
I love this comfortable, versatile, and surprisingly flattering shirt, and would not hesitate to order it again.
